items.name: Component_RotateAnimation
items.content:
# ===================================================================
#
#   Script: Component_RotateAnimation
#
#   $$COPYRIGHT$$
#
# ===================================================================
class Component_RotateAnimation extends gs.Component_Animation
    ###*
    * Executes a rotate-animation on a game-object.
    *
    * @module gs
    * @class Component_RotateAnimation
    * @extends gs.Component_Animation
    * @memberof gs
    * @constructor
    ###
    constructor: (data) ->
        super
        
        @easing = new gs.Easing(null, data?.easing)
        @callback = null
    
    ###*
    * Serializes the rotate-animation into a data-bundle.
    *
    * @method toDataBundle
    ###      
    toDataBundle: ->
        easing: @easing
    
    ###*
    * Updates the rotate-animation.
    *
    * @method update
    ###      
    update: ->
        super()
        if not @easing.isRunning then return
        
        @object.angle = @easing.value
        @easing.updateValue()
        
        if not @easing.isRunning and not @easing.isEndless
            @object.angle = Math.round(@object.angle)
            @callback?(@object, this)

    
    ###*
    * Starts the rotate-animation.
    *
    * @method rotateTo
    * @param {number} angle The target angle
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback called if the animation is finished. 
    ### 
    rotateTo: (angle, duration, easingType, callback) ->
        @easing.type = easingType || gs.Easings.EASE_LINEAR[gs.EasingTypes.EASE_IN]
        @callback = callback
        
        if duration == 0 or GameManager.tempSettings.skip
            @object.angle = angle
            @callback?(@object, this)
        else
            @easing.startValue(@object.angle, angle - @object.angle, duration)
            
    ###*
    * Starts the rotate-animation.
    *
    * @method start
    * @param {gs.RotationDirection} direction The rotation direction.
    * @param {number} speed The rotation speed in degrees per frame.
    * @param {number} duration The duration in frames.
    * @param {Object} easingType The easing-type.
    * @param {function} [callback] An optional callback called if the animation is finished. 
    ### 
    rotate: (direction, speed, duration, easingType, callback) ->
        @easing.type = easingType || gs.Easings.EASE_LINEAR[gs.EasingTypes.EASE_IN]
        @callback = callback
        @speed = speed
        @orgAngle = @object.angle
        if direction == 1
            speed = -speed
        
        if duration == 0 or GameManager.tempSettings.skip
            @object.angle += speed * duration
            @callback?(@object, this)
        else
            @easing.startValue(@object.angle, (@object.angle + speed * duration) - @object.angle, duration)
        
    ###*
    * Skips the animation. That is used to skip an animation if the user
    * wants to skip very fast through a visual novel scene.
    *
    * @method skip
    ###    
    skip: ->
        if @easing?.duration >= GameManager.tempSettings.skipTime
            @object.angle = @orgAngle + @speed * @easing.duration
            @easing.isRunning = no
            
gs.Component_RotateAnimation = Component_RotateAnimation
